name: Shrimp Summer Rolls with Asian Peanut Sauce
author: Austin Geraldson
summary: These shrimp summer rolls are great, and taste even better if you want to oven-bake or fry them as well. It only takes about 20 minutes to make, so it is much quicker than take out. These come highly recommended, you may want to make a double batch.
ingredients: ¼ pound medium shrimp - peeled and deveined
salt and ground black pepper to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat an outdoor grill or grill pan for medium-high heat
Place the shrimp in a bowl and toss with olive oil and salt and black pepper
Grill the shrimp on the preheated grill until opaque, 2 minutes per side
Remove from the grill and set aside
Combine the cabbage, carrot, garlic, 1 tablespoon ginger, teriyaki sauce, and lime juice in a bowl, stir well
Working with one at a time, wet rice paper with water and lay out on a clean surface
Place a quarter of the cabbage mixture in the center of the paper, top with a quarter of the shrimp
Shape the filling into a log shape and roll the rice paper around the filling, tucking the ends in as you go
Repeat with the remaining rice papers
Whisk together the peanut butter, teriyaki sauce, sesame oil, hot sauce, garlic, 1 tablespoon ginger, salt and pepper
Slice the rolls in half on an angle, and serve with the peanut sauce on the side
